Name: Alina Marie Barragan
Description:
Alina was strangled by Kozi Santino Scott after an intimate encounter. She was found in the trunk of Scott's car by police after they were alerted by a friend of the accused.

> SAN JOSE MURDER VICTIM IDENTIFIED
>
> [San Jose, CA: 1 Feb 00] The body of transgender woman, Alina, found in the trunk of a car on 19 Jan 00, is that of 19-year-old [deadname], known as Alina Marie Barragan. Kozi Santino Scott, 21, in whose car trunk Alina was found, was arrested and is being held at the Santa Clara County Jail. 
>
> The San Jose Mercury News reports that Scott met Alina at a bar on 18 Jan and invited her home with him. Scott subsequently told a friend about the killing. The friend called police and alerted them to look in the trunk, where Alina's body was wrapped in sheets and a blanket.
>
> The Attorney General's office is investigating whether to classify the killing as a hate crime, which could lengthen any sentence given to Scott should he be found guilty.
>
> A spokesman for the victim's family stated that Alina lived openly as a woman and was accepted by her family. Teenage girls in the neighborhood accepted her as one of their own. Jean Giguere, a former neighbor who knew Alina as a child, said it was evident that she felt most comfortable around girls. "[She] was a girl living in a boy's body," she said.
>
> Alina was well known at the Billy DeFrank Lesbian and Gay Community Center where she worked as a volunteer. The Center has established a fund for assisting Alina's family with funeral 
expenses. 

http://www.qrd.org/qrd/trans/san.jose.murder.victim.identified-02.01.00
Tweet:
Alina Marie Barragan was strangled by Kozi Santino Scott after an intimate encounter in San Jose, California (USA) on 19 Jan 2000.

She was 19. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR
